Attention ladies and gentlemen this is your captain speaking; 

1. Right click on the AES help icon on your desktop, a window appears...click on properties

2. Click "Find Target". (This will open the AES folder)

3. Right click on AES_0001.DAT, click properties then check "Read Only", click apply then click "ok"

4. Right click on AES_0002.DAT  click properties then check "Read Only", click apply then click "ok"

5. Next, open the "Scenery" folder in the AES Folder and right click on  AES_LFFFF0.BGL click properties then check "Read Only", click apply then click "ok"...that's it. Done!

The error message should not show up again no matter how many times u launch the Sim. When you need to change your AES configuration, or activate airports, just remove the "Read Only" status from the three (3) files and once you are finished re-apply the "Read Only" and fly to your hearts delight...Maintain Airspeed.

How do you deinstall from Scenery.cfg?
How do you delete from the registry?

for people not knowing how to delete from registry, you need to open up regedit (search in start) and open it up. it should have a UI like my computer or my documents. on the left, you have multiple options. two of these should be HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE and HKEY_USERS. open up HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. if you are running vista or W7, you need to go to this: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE -> SOFTWARE -> AEROSOFT -> Airport Enhancement Systems - delete this folder. there is also a folder name with a load of jibberish (eg: 732fj84fnfnv7n8v78vn3) delete that as well.

then, you go to HKEY_USERS -> Jibberish line -> VB and VBA program settings OR Software VB and VBA

and delete the folder inside (jibberish named folder)

then you can install :)

How to completely uninstall AES from Windows 7:

1. Go to the Aerosoft folder in the main FS9 folder and delete the remaining AES folder in FS9/Aerosoft/AES and also delete AES from the scenery.cfg.
2. go to the start menu click Run, and type Regedit.exe.
3. When the folder opens click HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Aerosoft\{D48E210F-8F8C-404e-B3D7-F4BF6881F193}
Delete this file
4. Then click HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\aerosoft\AES-Basepack&&AirportPack
Delete this file
5. Then click HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\aerosoft\Airport Enhancement Services
Delete this file
6. Then go to HKEY_USERS\S-1-5-21-1214440339-1450960922-839522115-1004\Software\VB an VBA Program Settings\{D48E210F-8F8C-404e-B3D7-F4BF6881F193}
Delete this file aswell
